msItem.title: I. Dawit “Psalter”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; headings and numbers of the psalms and other texts; incipits of the texts (usually written in alternating red and black lines); numbers of portions and names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; numbers and first lines (usually two) of the poems from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl; abbreviated refrains in Wǝddase Maryam (s. Abbreviations); elements of the punctuation signs; Additiones 1, 2.
In the first fol. of text I-4, the lines are written alternately in red and black.
msItem.note: The Ethiopic Psalter usually includes: I) Mäzmurä Dawit "Psalms of David"; II) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat "The Canticles of the Prophets"; III) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy "Song of Songs"; IV) Wǝddase Maryam “Glory of Mary”; V) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “Gate of Light”.

msItem.title: I) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; headings and numbers of the psalms and other texts; incipits of the texts (usually written in alternating red and black lines); numbers of portions and names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; numbers and first lines (usually two) of the poems from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl; abbreviated refrains in Wǝddase Maryam (s. Abbreviations); elements of the punctuation signs; Additiones 1, 2.
In the first fol. of text I-4, the lines are written alternately in red and black.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 2r, l.1: ነዓ፡ ኀቤየ፡ ዳዊት፡ ንጉሠ፡ እሥራኤል። በዐለ፡ መዝሙር፡ ሠናይ፡ ወጥዑመ፡ ቃል። ታለብወኒ፡ ነገረ፡ ወፍካሬ፡ ኲሉ፡ አምሳል። ከመ፡ እወድሳ፡ ለማርያም፡ ድንግል። እንዘ፡ እጸርሕ፡ ወእብል፨ መዝሙር፡ ዘዳዊት፡ ሃሌ፡ ሉያ። ፩፡ ብፁዕ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘኢሖረ፡ በምክረ፡ ረሲዓን፨[Fol. 2r, l.1]: Come to me, David, the King of Israel, Master of beautiful psalms and sweet of voice. Give me understanding of all the parables and interpretation thereof, So that I may praise the Virgin Mary, Exclaiming and saying: Psalter of David, Hallelujah. Ps. 1:1.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 154r, l.5: … ወአሰሰልኩ፡ ጽእለተ፡ እምደቂቀ፡ እስራኤል፨ ...................................................................... ... አቄርብ፡ ለኪ፡ ስብሐተ፡ ፈድፋደ፡ አሐደ፡ ወካልአ፡ እደ፨[Fol. 154r, l.5]: … and I took away disgrace from the children of Israel. ………………………………………………………………… … I shall offer you exceeding praise Once and twice.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 1r-193r (LöfUpp 31, no. 4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 8r-129r (StrBritLib 22, no. 17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 4r-163vb (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8).

note.p: Ps. 151:7 is followed by the corresponding poem from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl (for the Italian translation of the poem s. O. Raineri, Salmi etiopici di Cristo e della Vergine, Roma 2005,180-181).

msItem.title: II) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat "The Canticles of the Prophets"
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; headings and numbers of the psalms and other texts; incipits of the texts (usually written in alternating red and black lines); numbers of portions and names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; numbers and first lines (usually two) of the poems from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl; abbreviated refrains in Wǝddase Maryam (s. Abbreviations); elements of the punctuation signs; Additiones 1, 2.
In the first fol. of text I-4, the lines are written alternately in red and black.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 154v, l.1: መኃልየ፡ ነቢያት፡ወጸሎቱ፡ ለሙሴ። ፩፡ ንሴብሖ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ስቡሐ፡ ዘተሰብሐ። ፈረሰ፡ ወመስተፅዕነ፡ ወረወ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕር፨[Fol. 154v, l.1]: The Canticles of the Prophets and the prayer of Moses. Let us praise God the praised, who is praised; The horse and its rider He has thrown into the sea.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 170r, l.22: … ወክብረ፡ ለሕዝብከ፡ እስራኤል፨ ኦማርያም፡ ኢትርስዓኒ፡ ይእዜ። እንበለ፡ እጠንቅቅ፡ ዘርስዓን፡ ጊዜ። ኦርኅርኅት፡ ምልዕተ፡ ምሕረት፡ ከመ፡ ተከዜ። እስመ፡ ተሠልጠ፡ በላዕሌየ፡ ወተበውሃ፡ እንባዜ። ዘተሰፈውኩ፡ እረክብ፡ ማዕዜ። ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ። ለዓለም፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም።[Fol. 170r, l.22]: … and the glory of your people Israel. O Mary, do not forget me now, Before I reach the time of old age. O compassionate, full of mercy like a river! Since I am overpowered and overridden with despondency – When shall I find what I hope for? Glory be to the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit, For ever and unto the ages of ages.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 193v-212r (LöfUpp 31, no. 4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 129v-142v (StrBritLib 22, no. 17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 126r-138v (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8).

msItem.note: First Song of Moses (Ex. 15:1–19): fols. 154v-155v; Second Song of Moses (Deut. 32:1–21): fols. 155v-157r; Third Song of Moses (Deut. 32:22–43): fols. 157r-159r; Song of Hannah (I Sam. 2:1–10): fols. 159v-160v; Prayer of Hezekiah (Is. 38:10–20): fols. 160v-161v; Prayer of Manasseh (apocryphal): fols. 161v-162v; Song of Jonah (Jon. 2:3–10): fols. 162v-163r; First Song of the Three Youths in the Furnace (Dan 3: 28–45): fols. 163r-164r; Second Song of the Three Youths (Dan 3: 52–56): fols. 164r-164v; Third Song of the Three Youths (Dan 3: 57–88): fols. 164v-166v; Song of Habakkuk (Hab 3: 1–19): fols. 166v-168r; Song of Isaiah (Is 26: 9–20): fols. 168r-169r; Song of Our Lady Mary (Lk 1: 46–55): fols. 169r-169v; Song of Zachariah (Lk 1: 68–79): fols. 169v-170r; Song of Simeon (Lk 2: 29–32): fol. 170r-170v. The Song of Simeon is followed by the corresponding poem from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl (for the Italian translation of the poem s. O. Raineri, Salmi etiopici di Cristo e della Vergine, Roma 2005, 185) and the Trinitarian doxology.

msItem.title: III) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy "Song of Songs"
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; headings and numbers of the psalms and other texts; incipits of the texts (usually written in alternating red and black lines); numbers of portions and names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; numbers and first lines (usually two) of the poems from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl; abbreviated refrains in Wǝddase Maryam (s. Abbreviations); elements of the punctuation signs; Additiones 1, 2.
In the first fol. of text I-4, the lines are written alternately in red and black.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 171r, l.1: መኃልየ፡ መኃልይ፡ ዝውእቱ፡ ዘሰሎሞን። ፩፡ ይስዕመኒ፡ በስዕመተ፡ አፉሁ። አዳም፡ አጥባትኪ፡ እምወይን፨[Fol. 171r, l.1]: Song of Songs, of Solomon. Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth. Your breasts are more pleasant than wine.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 178v, l.13: … ወ{እመ፡ አኮ፡} ከመ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ኀየል፡ ውስተ፡ አድባረ፡ ቤቴል፨ …………………………………….. ... ዘተመነይኩ፡ ሀብኒ፡ ወዘኃሠሥኩ፨ በማኅሌት፡ ወበመዝሙር፡ ስመኪ፡ ነገርኩ፨ ወዘወሀብክኒ፡ ግብርየ፡ ፈጸምኩ፨[Fol. 178v, l.13]: ... and if not, then like a young hart on the hills of Bethel. ............................................................................................... ... give me that which I long for and which I seek. In song and in psalmody will I speak out your name And the work which you have entrusted me with I have accomplished.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 212v-227r (LöfUpp 31, no. 4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 143r-151v (StrBritLib 23, no. 17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 139r-146r (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8).

note.p: The last verse of Song of Songs is followed by the corresponding poem from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl (for the Italian translation of the poem s. O. RAINERI, Salmi etiopici di Cristo e della Vergine, Roma 2005,186-187).

msItem.title: IV) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; headings and numbers of the psalms and other texts; incipits of the texts (usually written in alternating red and black lines); numbers of portions and names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; numbers and first lines (usually two) of the poems from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl; abbreviated refrains in Wǝddase Maryam (s. Abbreviations); elements of the punctuation signs; Additiones 1, 2.
In the first fol. of text I-4, the lines are written alternately in red and black.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 179ra, l.1: ናሁ፡ ናሁ፡ እግረ፡ ሕሊናየ፡ ቆማ፡ አዕይንትየኒ፡ ያንቀአድዋ፡ መልዕልተ፡ ራማ፨ ለውዳሴኪ፡ ማርያም፡ መጠነ፡ ኊልቋ፡ ወአቅማ።[Fol. 179ra, l.1]: Behold, behold, the feet of my intelligence are standing, My eyes are looking up with devotion toward the third heaven To praise you, Mary, according to their number and ability.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 194rb, l.13: ብፁዕ፡ ብእሲ፡ መንፈሰ፡ ጸጋኪ፡ ዘተውህቦ፡ {ከመ፡ ኪያኪ፡} ይዌድስ፡ ወዋህደኪ፡ በተራክቦ፨ ማርያም፡ ርግብ፡ በሐመልማለ፡ ወርቅ፡ ሥርጉተ፡ ገቦ፨ ወብፁዕ፡ ለዕበይኪ፡ እንተ፡ የአምር፡ የብቦ፨ ታስተዳልዊ፡ በሰማይ፡ ወበምድር፡ አስቦ፨[Fol. 194rb, l.13]: Blessed is the man who has been endowed with the spirit of your grace, So that he may praise you and you only, [standing] face to face with you, Mary, the dove whose side is adorned with the verdure of gold; And blessed is he who knows how to rejoice at your greatness - Prepare for him a reward in heaven and on earth.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 231-251 (LöfUpp 32, n°4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 152r-161v (StrBritLib 23, n°17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 146ra-158rb (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8).

note.p: Each daily portion of Wǝddase Maryam is followed by a short poem similar in metrical structure to those of Mäzmurä dǝngǝl. A poem of the same kind also opens the book. For excerpts from these poems s. Incipit and Explicit.

msItem.title: V) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “Gate of Light”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; headings and numbers of the psalms and other texts; incipits of the texts (usually written in alternating red and black lines); numbers of portions and names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; numbers and first lines (usually two) of the poems from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl; abbreviated refrains in Wǝddase Maryam (s. Abbreviations); elements of the punctuation signs; Additiones 1, 2.
In the first fol. of text I-4, the lines are written alternately in red and black.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 194va, l.1: ውዳሴ፡ ወግናይ፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ቅድስት፡ ወብፅዕት፡ ስብሕት፡ ወቡርክት፡ ክብርት፡ ወልዕልት፡ አንቀጸ፡ ብርሃን፡ መዐርገ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወማኅደረ፡ መለኮት፡ ቅድስተ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ አንቲ፡ ውእቱ፡…[Fol. 194va, l.1]: Praise and homage to Our Lady Mary. The holy one and the blessed one, the praised and the happy one, the glorious and the exalted one, the gate of light, the ladder of life and the abode of the Divinity, the Holy of Holies you are…

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 252r-260v (LöfUpp 32, n°4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 161v-166r (StrBritLib 23, n°17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 158rb-163vb (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8).

msItem.locus: Passages distributed in texts I-1, I-2 and I-3 (fols. 2r-178v).
msItem.title: VI) Mäzmurä dǝngǝl “Psalter of the Virgin”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; headings and numbers of the psalms and other texts; incipits of the texts (usually written in alternating red and black lines); numbers of portions and names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; numbers and first lines (usually two) of the poems from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl; abbreviated refrains in Wǝddase Maryam (s. Abbreviations); elements of the punctuation signs; Additiones 1, 2.
In the first fol. of text I-4, the lines are written alternately in red and black.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 2r, l.1: ነዓ፡ ኀቤየ፡ ዳዊት፡ ንጉሠ፡ እሥራኤል። በዐለ፡ መዝሙር፡ ሠናይ፡ ወጥዑመ፡ ቃል። ታለብወኒ፡ ነገረ፡ ወፍካሬ፡ ኵሉ፡ አምሳል። ከመ፡ እወድሳ፡ ለማርያም፡ ድንግል። እንዘ፡ እጸርሕ፡ ወእብል፨[Fol. 2r, l.1]: Come to me, David, the King of Israel, Master of beautiful psalms and sweet of voice. Give me understanding of all the parables and interpretation thereof, So that I may praise the Virgin Mary, Exclaiming and saying.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 178v, l.14: መኑ፡ ይእቲ፡ ዛቲ፡ ትቤ፡ ራእይ። ፭፡ እንተ፡ ትሔውጽ፡ ከመ፡ ጎሕ፡ ድኅረ፡ ለያልይ። በእንቲአኪ፡ ማርያም፡ ሙፃአ፡ ፀሐይ፨ ክነፈ፡ ፍቅርኪ፡ ክነፈ፡ እሳት፡ ውዑይ፨ አጥፍኦቶ፡ ኢይክል፡ ማይ፨ ስብሐታቲኪ፡ ማርያም፡ ከመ፡ እንተ፡ ሕልቀት፡ አድሎኩ። ዘበበይኖን፡ እምዘ፡ ሰመይኩ። ዘተመነይኩ፡ ሀብኒ፡ ወዘኃሠሥኩ፨ በማኅሌት፡ ወበመዝሙር፡ ስመኪ፡ ነገርኩ፨ ወዘወሀብክኒ፡ ግብርየ፡ ፈጸምኩ፨[Fol. 178v, l.14]: Who is she, says the revelation, That looks on [us] as the dawn after nights? For your sake, Mary, the sun rises; The wings of your love are wings of burning fire Which water cannot extinguish. Your praises, Mary, I have prepared as [finger] rings, When I have named each of them (?). Give me what I long for and what I seek. In song and in psalmody I proclaimed your name And the work which you have entrusted me with I have accomplished.

msItem.note: The outer margins of the folios are quite narrow for an unknown reason (possibly trimmed; or the scribe wrongly calculated the size of the script). Part of the note on fol. 193r has been cut off.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 198.0 folios, of which 0.0 blank , in 25.0 quires .
31.0 27.0 8.5
supportDesc.condition: The leather cover on the spine is damaged, partly missing.

layout.ab: Ruling is mostly visible; pricking is partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
In many fols. the scribe did not used the bottom ruled line.

layout.note: Texts IV and V. Data for fol. 172. In texts IV and V, the right margin is very narrow (trimmed?).
layout.ab: Ruling is mostly visible; pricking is partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
In many fols. the scribe did not used the bottom ruled line.

list.item: I. Colon; short line with dots above and below (säräz; usually before and after abbreviations)
II. Four dot asterisk (mostly after rubricated lines); nine dot asterisk (mostly after non-rubricated lines)

III. Chain of black and red dots; chain of red and black dashes (mostly used before and after poems from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl, s. Varia, and between portions of Wǝddase Maryam); two chains of red and black dashes with a row of nine dot asterisks between them (e.g., fols. 154r, 170v, 194r).
In Wǝddase Maryam, refrains of each daily portion are occasionally abbreviated to their first word or part of the first word (e.g., fol. 179va, l.4; 181rb, l.6).

Fol. 1v: Ownership note.Fol. 1v: ዝንቱ፡ መጽፍ[sic]፡ ዘእማሆይ፡ ብሩር፡ ዘውዴ፡ ወስመ፡ ክርስትናሀ፡ ወለተ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወስመ፡ አቡሀ፡ ወልደ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ ወስመ፡ እማ፡ ወለተ፡ እግዚእ፡ ወብእሲሀ፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ወእሁሀ፡ ገብረ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ወእህቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ጊወርጊስ፡ ወውሉዳ፡ ገብረ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ገብረ፡ ተክለሃይማኖት። አቶ፡ ሐጐ[sic]፡ ወልደ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ኦአበውየ፡ ወአሀውየ፡ ሶበ፡ ታነብብዎ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ መጽሀፍ፡ ኢትርስኡኒ፡ ለአመትሙ[sic]፡ ወለተ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ Fol. 1v: This book is of to ʾǝmmahoy Bǝrur Zäwde, whose baptismal name is Wälättä Qirqos. Her father’s name is Wäldä Rufaʾel, her mother’s name is Wälättä ʾƎgziʾ, her husband is Wäldä Maryam, her brother is Gäbrä ʾArägawi, his sister is Wälätta Giwärgis, her sons are Gäbrä ʾIyäsus and Gäbrä Täklähaymanot, ʾato Ḥagwä[s] Wäldä Gäbrǝʾel. O my fathers and my brothers, when you read this book, do not forget your servant Wälättä Qirqos. Written in red.

Fol. 197r: Donation note.Fol. 197r: በስ፡ አብ፡ ወልድ፡ ወመፈ[sic]፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩ አላክ[sic]፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሀፍ፡ ዘእማሆይ፡ ብሩር፡ ዘውዴ፡ ዘወሀበት፡ ለማርያም፡ ሰበያ፡ ወስመ፡ ክስትናሀ፡ ወለተ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወስመ፡ አቡሀ፡ ወልደ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ ወስመ፡ እማ፡ ወለተ፡ እግዚእ፡ ወእሁሀ፡ ገብረ፡ አረጋዊ፡ ወአሀቲሀ፡ ወለተ፡ ጊወርጊስ፡ ወለተ፡ ኪዳን፡ ወእህተ፡ እማ፡ ወለተ፡ ሚካኤል። ሱም፡ አጋሜ፡ ወልዱ፡ ዘመፈስ[sic]፡ ቅዱስ፡ ደጃዝማች፡ ወልደሚካኤ[sic] ወለተ፡ ሙሴ፡ Fol. 197r: In the name of the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit, One God. This book is of ʾǝmmahoy Bǝrur Zäwde who donated it to Maryam Säbäya; her baptismal name is Wälättä Qirqos, her father’s name is Wäldä Rufaʾel, her mother’s name is Wälättä ʾƎgziʾ, her brother is Gäbrä ʾArägawi, her sisters are Wälättä Giwärgis and Wälättä Kidan, her maternal aunt is Wälättä Mikaʾel. Šum ʾAgame (is) däğğazmač Wäldä Mikaʾe[l], the son of Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and Wälättä Muse. Written in red ink.
Fol. 197v: Calendar notes with indications of new moon dates for each month and memories of saints falling on the days of new moons.

- Each psalm, each prophetic canticle and each chapter of “Song of Songs” are followed by a poem from Mäzmurä Dǝngǝl, usually separated from the preceding and the following texts by chains of red and black dashes. For the Italian translation of these poems s. O. RAINERI, Salmi etiopici di Cristo e della Vergine, Roma, 2005, 133-187. - Exhortation to the reader to pray for the donor: fol. 2r (upper margin). - Minor notes in the upper margin: fols. 91v, 114r, 193r (partly cut).

binding.decoNote: Wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 7 tools were used: triple line fillet, interlaced dot fillet, double circle, double sine wave with dots, cross hatching, x-form, small x).

origin.origDate: First half of the 19th century. In Additio 2, ʾǝmmahoy Bǝrur Zäwde appears as a contemporary or a relative of däğğazmač Wäldä Mikaʾel, the governor of ʿAgame (a son of däğğazmač Subagadis).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: ʾǝmmahoy Bǝrur Zäwde (s. the donation note, fol. 197r).
ʾǝmmahoy Bǝrur Zäwde “whose baptismal name is Wälättä Qirqos” (s. Additio 2).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
